entries.description:
THE FNCS INVITATIONAL

FOR THE FIRST TIME SINCE 2019, OFFICIAL IN-PERSON FORTNITE COMPETITION RETURNS WITH THE FNCS INVITATIONAL 2022. OVER 100k PLAYERS FROM AROUND THE WORLD COMPETED TO EARN AN INVITE AND NOW IT'S DOWN TO JUST 100 PLAYERS. WATCH AS THEY COMPETE FOR A SHARE OF THE $1,000,000 PRIZE POOL AT THE FNCS INVITATIONAL 2022!
 

BUY TICKETS

TIME & LOCATION

NOVEMBER 12-13 AT THE RALEIGH CONVENTION CENTER, 500 S SALISBURY ST, RALEIGH, NORTH CAROLINA, UNITED STATES.

EARLY ACCESS: 1:00PM ET

DOORS OPEN: 1:30PM ET

SHOW STARTS: 2:30PM ET

WHAT'S THERE

SEVERAL PHOTO OPPORTUNITIES, NEW AND FRESH FORTNITE MERCH, AND SPECIAL PARTNER COLLABORATIONS!

sections.description: Epic Games is committed to following all local and federal health guidance. For the latest COVID health guidance please see the Wake County guidance and the US CDC guidance.
sections.title: Are there Health and Safety policies for the FNCS Invitational 2022?

sections.description: All tickets for the FNCS Invitational 2022 will be digitally distributed as mobile tickets via Ticketmaster. A capable device will be required to access and scan your tickets for entry. Make sure your device is charged to avoid being denied access to the event without the ability to verify a valid ticket.
sections.title: How do I access my tickets?

sections.description: A ticket is valid only for each individual day of the FNCS Invitational 2022 (the Event). If the Event is canceled or suspended, not rescheduled or resumed in the same venue, or played without fans, or with limited fans, in attendance, Epic Games will determine in their sole discretion whether any refunds will be issued and post such decision at fortnite.com/competitive.
sections.title: What is the ticket policy?

sections.description: Yes, there will be apparel and merchandise available for purchase at the event. Retail locations will feature an assortment of merchandise including event specific merchandise.
sections.title: Is there going to be any retail at the FNCS Invitational 2022?

sections.description: Yes, concessions can be purchased at the event, provided by Centerplate. Concessions will be available throughout the entire event. Concessions will be cashless to keep lines moving.
sections.title: Will there be concessions?

sections.description: For parking information, please visit the Raleigh Convention Center Directions and Parking page.
sections.title: What are the parking options?

sections.description: No backpacks or large bags will be permitted (diaper bags are allowed). Clear bags are recommended for ease of entry. All bags will be searched upon entry.
sections.title: What is the bag policy?

events.metaDescription: Play, compete, and qualify for the Fortnite Champion Series: Grand Royale. This is your one stop shop for all information as the Grand Royale progresses, check back for updates on standings and schedule.

entries.description:
What is it?

FNCS Grand Royale is the end of year finale for FNCS!

What's the format?

All eligible teams will participate in the Load Session, where the top 33 teams will advance to Victory Path.
Winning a match in a Victory Path session will advance your team to the Finals.
Finals will consist of 12 matches across two days.

Who can participate? 

FNCS Elite players can create a team with anyone and compete in the FNCS Grand Royale in Chapter 2 Season 8.
Become an FNCS Elite player by reaching a single lobby stage (Round 4, Semi-Finals, or Finals) in FNCS at any point in 2021.

sections.description: https://www.epicgames.com/fortnite/competitive/en-US/news/2021-fncs-grand-royale-official-rules
sections.title: OFFICIAL RULES

sections.description:
• All eligible teams will participate in the Load Session, where the top 33 teams will advance to Victory Path.
  • There will be 4 Victory Path sessions, each with 8 matches.
  • Winning a match in a Victory Path session will advance your team to the Grand Finals.
  • Once a team has arrived on Victory Path, they will remain on it for the remaining sessions until they either advance to the Finals or the 4th session ends.
  • During each Victory Path session, a Reload Session will also take place simultaneously, open to all eligible participants who are not on Victory Path.
  • At the start of each Victory Path session, teams that advance to the Finals will be backfilled from the Top 8 teams in the prior Reload Session.
  • The team with the most cumulative eliminations during Victory Path who hasn’t already qualified will fill out the 33rd spot in the Finals.
sections.title: FNCS GRAND ROYALE: QUALIFIER FORMAT

sections.description:
• The Finals occur across two days, with the pinnacle competition of each region’s top 33 teams. These teams will be directly competing with each other over two days in 12 games.
  • Day 2 scoring will be worth double points to keep everyone in the action!
  • At the conclusion of the 12th game of the Finals, regional champions will be crowned!
sections.title: FNCS GRAND ROYALE: FINALS QUALIFIER FORMAT

events.metaDescription: Play, compete, and qualify for the Fortnite Champion Series: Chapter 3 - Season 1. This is your one stop shop for all information as the competitive Chapter 3 - Season 1 progresses, check back for updates on standings and schedule.

entries.description:
DUOS

CHAMPION-RANKED TEAMS CAN COMPETE IN THE QUALIFIERS IN CHAPTER 3 SEASON 1 ON FEBRUARY 17-18 AND FEBRUARY 19-20.

EVERY GAME COUNTS

TOP TEAMS AT THE END OF EACH QUALIFIER WILL SKIP DIRECTLY TO THE FINALS. CONSISTENCY WILL DICTATE WHICH TEAMS WILL ADVANCE TO THE SEMI-FINALS, WHICH WILL BE FILLED OUT FROM TEAMS WITH THE HIGHEST SERIES POINTS ACROSS BOTH QUALIFIERS WHO HAVE NOT YET QUALIFIED DIRECTLY TO FINALS.

CHAMPIONS AROUND THE WORLD

THE BEST PLAYERS FROM THE SEMI-FINALS WILL COMPETE IN THE FINALS ON MARCH 4-6 TO DETERMINE THE CHAPTER 3 SEASON 1 CHAMPIONS IN EACH REGION.

sections.title: Official Rules

sections.description:
Reach Champion League in Arena mode to unlock this event. The weekly stages occur across three rounds - Round One (Opens), Round Two (Semi-Finals) and Round Three (Finals). The top teams from Round Three in each region will advance to the Season Finals on December 6-8.

Teams will also accumulate Series Points based on each week's final placements tracked on the Series Leaderboard. Every week counts, as top performers on the Series Leaderboard will also qualify into the Season Finals.
sections.title: FNCS: Chapter 2 - Season 1 Format

sections.description: Advance from a previous Series Weekly or be top ranked on the Series Leaderboard to be invited to this event. This tournament occurs across two rounds - Group Stages (top 100 teams from NAE, NAW, EU, and BR regions and top 50 teams from OCE, ASIA, and ME region) and Grand Finals (top 24 teams per region). For Group Stage, all qualified teams are seeded into a single session based on their final standings on the Series Leaderboard. The top teams from each session will advance to the Grand Finals.
sections.title: FNCS: Chapter 2 - Season 1 Season Finals

sections.description:
Q: If I play with different teammates in different weeks, do my Series Points carry over?

A: No. Each team must consist of the same four players for Series Points to carry over. Each team of four players is unique, and holds Series Points based on that original team of four players. Changing any member of the team creates a new unique team, which begins at 0 Series Points.

Q: A team in my region has qualified in a previous week. The same team finished in the auto qualification spots on an additional week. Does that mean that the auto qualification spot goes to the next highest ranked team on that week’s leaderboard?

A: No. Prizes and Series Points are awarded to the already-qualified team based on final placement. However, the auto qualification spot for that week is removed, and instead added to the final count to be pulled from the Series Points Leaderboard at the end of the 4th week.

Q: When does the tournament start each week?

A: It depends based on server region. All start times will be listed within the Compete tab in game.

Q: How do Trades work?

A: This season of FNCS, trading amongst already qualified Teams is not permitted.

Q: I qualified with multiple different Teams. What are the rules for who plays in the Season Finals?

A: The first Team that meets the qualification criteria is the Team that is valid for the Season Finals. If a member of the qualified Team meets the criteria for qualifying again with any different player(s), this second qualification will not be valid. In order to make the second qualification valid, all four (4) players from the valid qualification must unanimously agree and request to disband their Team by contacting an Event Administrator, reachable via email at tournaments@epicgames.com before the deadline of Sunday, November 24th at 11:00 PM ET.

Q: I’m unable to queue for the event. Can you help?

A: Make sure all members of your team are ranked in Champion League, partied together, and have Two Factor Authentication (2FA) enabled. You can do so by following this guide: https://www.epicgames.com/fortnite/news/2fa

We’ve also seen that remaking the party with a different party leader fixes some rare occurrences where a team is unable to queue.

If the issue still persists, please reach out to our support team here: https://epicgames.helpshift.com/a/fortnite/?contact=1

standings.headerContent:
Leaderboard

Your final placement each week earns your team Series Points that get added to the Series Leaderboard. This is your overall score in the Fortnite Champion Series, with the highest scoring teams filling out the remaining spots in the Season Finals. Check out the running tallies, and search for your own score to see how close you are to getting through to the Finals! Be sure to enter your name exactly as it appears in-game.

events.metaDescription: Play, compete, and qualify for the Fortnite Champion Series: Chapter 3 - Season 3. This is your one stop shop for all information as the competitive Chapter 3 - Season 3 progresses, check back for updates on standings and schedule.

entries.description:
DUOS

CHAMPION-RANKED TEAMS CAN COMPETE IN THE QUALIFIERS FOR CHAPTER 3 SEASON 3 ON JULY 6, 11, AND 16

EVERY GAME COUNTS

TOP TEAMS AT THE END OF EACH QUALIFIER WILL SKIP DIRECTLY TO THE FINALS. TO ADVANCE TO THE SEMI-FINALS, CONSISTENCY IS KEY. TEAMS WITH THE HIGHEST SERIES POINTS ACROSS ALL QUALIFIERS WHO HAVE NOT YET QUALIFIED DIRECTLY TO FINALS WILL ADVANCE TO THE SEMI-FINALS

CHAMPIONS AROUND THE WORLD

THE BEST TEAMS FROM THE SEMI-FINALS WILL COMPETE IN THE FINALS FROM AUGUST 12-14 TO DETERMINE THE CHAPTER 3 SEASON 3 CHAMPIONS IN EACH REGION

sections.description: https://www.epicgames.com/fortnite/competitive/news/fortnite-champion-series-chapter-3-season-3-official-rules
sections.title: Official Rules

sections.description:
You and your teammate must reach the Champion League in Arena mode to unlock this event.

Each open Qualifier occurs across three rounds. The top players from the final round in each region will skip directly to the Finals on August 12-14. Players will accumulate Series Points based on final placements for each Qualifier, tracked on the Series Leaderboard. Every Qualifier counts, as top teams on the Series Leaderboard (who haven't already qualified for Finals) will advance to the Semi-Finals.
sections.title: FORTNITE CHAMPION SERIES: CHAPTER 3 SEASON 3 QUALIFIER FORMAT

sections.description:
The top 73 teams on the Series Leaderboard still have an opportunity to qualify for Finals. The top 50 teams on the Series Leaderboard will kick the Semi Finals off by competing in 5 matches during Session 1 of the Semi-Finals. Each team that achieves a Victory Royale immediately advances to Finals and will cement themselves at the top of the Session 1 Leaderboard. At the end of the day’s Session, the 6th-11th place teams who did not achieve a Victory Royale will also advance to the Finals based on consistency.

Session 2 of Semi-Finals will add the 51st-61st teams on the Series Leaderboard into the competition alongside the teams that did not advance from Session 1. All these teams will compete in 6 matches for Session 2. Like before, each team that achieves a Victory Royale immediately advances to Finals and will cement themselves at the top of the Session 2 Leaderboard. The 7th-12th place teams in the session will also advance to the Finals based on consistency.

Session 3 of Semi-Finals will move the 62nd-73rd teams on the Series Leaderboard into the competition alongside the remaining teams that did not advance from Session 1 or Session 2. For the final chance at the Finals, all teams will play 6 more matches in this Session. Like before, each team that achieves a Victory Royale immediately advances to Finals and will cement themselves at the top of the Session 3 Leaderboard. The 7th-12th place teams in the session will also advance to the Finals based on consistency.
sections.title: FORTNITE CHAMPION SERIES: CHAPTER 3 SEASON 3 SEMI-FINALS FORMAT

sections.description:
The Finals occur across two days, with the pinnacle competition of each region’s top 50 teams. These teams will be directly competing with each other over two days in 12 total games.

At the conclusion of the 12th game of the Finals, regional champions will be crowned!

  • Match Point: A team may end the competition early if they reach three Victory Royales and 475 total points.
sections.title: FORTNITE CHAMPION SERIES: CHAPTER 3 SEASON 3 FINALS FORMAT

events.metaDescription: Play, compete, and qualify for the Fortnite Champion Series 2023: Major 2 - Online. This is your one stop shop for all information as the Major 2progresses, check back for updates on standings and schedule.

entries.description:
THE SECOND MAJOR

THE FIRST BATCH OF DUOS HAVE ALREADY SECURED THEIR SPOT TO THE FNCS GLOBAL CHAMPIONSHIP IN MAJOR 1. AT THE CONCLUSION OF THIS TOURNAMENT WE WILL MEET THE NEXT ELITE CONTENDERS FOR THE GLOBAL CHAMPIONSHIP TITLE AND SHARE OF THE $4,000,000 PRIZE POOL!

NORTH AMERICA MERGE

NORTH AMERICAN PLAYERS WILL COMPETE UNDER ONE UNIFIED COMPETITIVE REGION, NORTH AMERICA, INSTEAD OF THE PREVIOUSLY SPLIT REGIONS, NA-EAST AND NA-WEST.

HOW TO QUALIFY

FNCS MAJOR 2 WILL NOT BE USING THE DIVISIONAL CUP SYSTEM FROM FNCS MAJOR 1, IN AN EFFORT TO ALLOW MORE PLAYERS TO COMPETE IN FNCS. ALL CHAMPION LEAGUE PLAYERS ARE ELIGIBLE TO PARTICIPATE! 

WHERE TO WATCH

YOU CAN WATCH VIA LEGENDS LANDING IN-GAME (ISLAND CODE 3303-7480-5925) ON THE OFFICIAL FNCS LIVESTREAM IN SUPPORTED LANGUAGES, OR LIVE ON TWITCH, YOUTUBE, TWITTER, FACEBOOK AND TIKTOK.

sections.description: https://www.fortnite.com/competitive/news/fortnite-champion-series-major-2-2023-official-rules
sections.title: OFFICIAL RULES

sections.description:
WEEKLY COMPETITION
  • April 13-16 (3 rounds)
  • April 20-23 (3 rounds)
  • April 27-30 (3 rounds)

FNCS MAJOR 2 SURGE WEEK
  • May 5-7 (1 round)

FNCS MAJOR 2 GRAND FINALS
  • May 12-14 (2 days)
sections.title: SCHEDULE

sections.description:
You and your teammate must reach the Champion League in Arena mode to unlock this event.

For each weekly FNCS Major 2 competition, the top 200 highest points-earning duos from Round 1 will advance to that week’s Round 2 session. Following the conclusion of the Round 2 session, the top 50 highest points-earning duos from each region will advance to that week’s FNCS Major 2 Weekly Finals.

Each duo that participates in the furthest round and/or stage reached for a given weekly FNCS Major 2 competition will be awarded Series Points based on their results from that week. The top 40 duos (in other words, the 40 duos who’ve earned the highest cumulative Series Points on the Series Leaderboard across Weeks 1, 2, and 3) will qualify for the FNCS Major 2 Grand Finals.
sections.title: FORTNITE CHAMPION SERIES 2023: MAJOR 2 WEEKLY PLAY FORMAT

sections.description:
Duos who place 41st through 90th on the Series Leaderboard after the three weeks of FNCS Major 2 weekly competition will advance to the FNCS Major 2 Surge Week. These duos will compete in five FNCS Major 2 Surge Week matches for an extra opportunity to earn one of the last spots in the FNCS Major 2 Grand Finals.

The five duos who claim a Victory Royale during any one of the Major 2 Surge Week matches will advance to the Major 2 Grand Finals, and the next 6th through 10th duos with the most points on the Leaderboard will also advance to the Grand Finals.
sections.title: FORTNITE CHAMPION SERIES 2023: MAJOR 2 SURGE WEEK FORMAT

sections.description: The FNCS Major 2 Grand Finals will take place across two days of competition, with six matches each day for a total of twelve matches. Duos with the highest cumulative points on the applicable FNCS Major 2 Grand Finals leaderboard will earn a piece of the $2,001,200 prize pool, and the top duos in each region will advance to the FNCS Global Championship 2023.
sections.title: FORTNITE CHAMPION SERIES 2023: MAJOR 2 GRAND FINALS FORMAT

sections.description:
• EU - 5 Qualifying Duos
  • NA - 3 Qualifying Duos
  • Brazil - 1 Qualifying Duo
  • Oceania - 1 Qualifying Duo
  • Middle East - 1 Qualifying Duo
  • Asia - 1 Qualifying Duo
sections.title: MAJOR 2 QUALIFICATION SPOTS FOR THE FNCS GLOBAL CHAMPIONSHIP 2023

standings.headerContent:
Leaderboard

Your final placement each qualifier earns you Series Points that get added to the Series Leaderboard. This is your overall score in the Fortnite Champion Series. Check out the running tallies, and search for your own score to see how close you are to getting through to the Finals! Be sure to enter your name exactly as it appears in-game.

events.metaDescription: Play, compete, and qualify for the Fortnite Champion Series 2023: Major 1 - Online. This is your one stop shop for all information as the Major 1 progresses, check back for updates on standings and schedule.

entries.description:
WELCOME TO 2023

FNCS IS BACK FOR 2023 WITH A NEW “MAJOR” STRUCTURE, A $10,000,000 TOTAL PRIZE POOL AND A GLOBAL CHAMPIONSHIP IN-PERSON EVENT!

EVERY MAJOR COUNTS

EACH FNCS MAJOR WILL BE CRUCIAL TO EARNING YOUR SPOT IN THE FORTNITE CHAMPION SERIES GLOBAL CHAMPIONSHIP 2023 TAKING PLACE IN COPENHAGEN, DENMARK IN LATE 2023.

HOW TO QUALIFY

FETCH YOUR DUOS PARTNER AND PREPARE FOR THE FNCS MAJOR 1 TO BEGIN ON FEBRUARY 2, 2023. THIS FNCS MAJOR WILL TAKE OVER ELITE DIVISIONAL CUPS FOR A TOTAL OF FIVE WEEKS DURING CHAPTER 4 SEASON 1, AND PLAYERS WHO EARN ELITE DIVISION IN THIS SEASON WILL UNLOCK PARTICIPATION IN FNCS MAJOR 1. 
 

WHERE TO WATCH

YOU CAN WATCH FNCS IN-GAME AT LEGEND’S LANDING, ON THE OFFICIAL FNCS LIVE STREAM IN SUPPORTED LANGUAGES, OR YOU CAN WATCH NATIVELY VIA ANY OF THE LINKS BELOW OR USE THE CLEAN FEED TO CREATE YOUR OWN WATCH PARTY.

sections.description: https://www.fortnite.com/competitive/news/fortnite-champion-series-major-1-2023-official-rules
sections.title: Official Rules

sections.description:
You and your teammate must reach the Champion League in Arena mode to unlock this event.

Each open Qualifier occurs across three rounds. The top players from the final round in each region will skip directly to the Finals on August 12-14. Players will accumulate Series Points based on final placements for each Qualifier, tracked on the Series Leaderboard. Every Qualifier counts, as top teams on the Series Leaderboard (who haven't already qualified for Finals) will advance to the Semi-Finals.
sections.title: FORTNITE CHAMPION SERIES 2023: MAJOR 1 WEEKLY PLAY FORMAT

sections.description:
The top 73 teams on the Series Leaderboard still have an opportunity to qualify for Finals. The top 50 teams on the Series Leaderboard will kick the Semi Finals off by competing in 5 matches during Session 1 of the Semi-Finals. Each team that achieves a Victory Royale immediately advances to Finals and will cement themselves at the top of the Session 1 Leaderboard. At the end of the day’s Session, the 6th-11th place teams who did not achieve a Victory Royale will also advance to the Finals based on consistency.

Session 2 of Semi-Finals will add the 51st-61st teams on the Series Leaderboard into the competition alongside the teams that did not advance from Session 1. All these teams will compete in 6 matches for Session 2. Like before, each team that achieves a Victory Royale immediately advances to Finals and will cement themselves at the top of the Session 2 Leaderboard. The 7th-12th place teams in the session will also advance to the Finals based on consistency.

Session 3 of Semi-Finals will move the 62nd-73rd teams on the Series Leaderboard into the competition alongside the remaining teams that did not advance from Session 1 or Session 2. For the final chance at the Finals, all teams will play 6 more matches in this Session. Like before, each team that achieves a Victory Royale immediately advances to Finals and will cement themselves at the top of the Session 3 Leaderboard. The 7th-12th place teams in the session will also advance to the Finals based on consistency.
sections.title: FORTNITE CHAMPION SERIES 2023: MAJOR 1 SURGE WEEK FORMAT

sections.description:
The Finals occur across two days, with the pinnacle competition of each region’s top 50 teams. These teams will be directly competing with each other over two days in 12 total games.

At the conclusion of the 12th game of the Finals, regional champions will be crowned!
sections.title: FORTNITE CHAMPION SERIES 2023: MAJOR GRAND FINALS FORMAT
